reviewText:
Didn't even notice how many hours I've spent on this game!? I did however play every class to level 20 before settling on the Mystic(level 58 at the time of writing), So I deleted lots of characters.

Pros:
-Not PAY to WIN!  I haven't spent a dime on it, but after looking at the hours I've put in, I'll most likly buy a level sixty ticket and an extra character slot just too feel like I've paid for it in some respect.
-Lots of classes too choose from. 2 tanks, 2 healers, and a whole mess of DPS
-Nice graphics! The best I've came across in a FTPMMORPG
-Easy to get into combat, but has lots of stuff to master as you reach into the end game.
-Broker is very easy to navigate, and if you have the time can yield lots of gold that you can use to buy some really nice stuff, without having to grind instances for.

Meh Stuff:
-On my server there are over 15,000 guilds, Anyone and his brother can make a guild.
-Global chat can be a bit cru.....just turn global chat off, and save yourself a headache.
-There seems to be a beach volley ball thing going on this summer...be prepared to see teen and adult characters both male and female, barley dressed, and going into a dungeon of darkness with extra dark shades on.

Cons:
-Graphics: This is NOT gonna run on your Mother's laptop!  If it does then it's a good thing you're already in the basment, cuz that hardware..... It's gonna get hot.
-Lag: The combat system needs a good solid conection to be worth anything. A one second delay after you press a dodge, block, jump, heal, or timed attack will have you screaming at your screen. If you find your server lagging, play something else for an hour.
-Did I mention beach volley ball?
-Quests are just as lame as every other MMO I've ever played, don't expect much there.
-Huge Game: takes forever to download on slower conections.

Tips:
-Use the free Elite pass that comes when you make a new account: You get double XPs, a fast mount, and two loot boxes(one of which will give you something you can sell at the broker for a good chunck of gold).
-If you like playing instances without A LOT of wait time in Que, play a healer or a tank.
-Turn OFF" Global Chat!
-The Gunner is the ultimate solo machine if you don't feel like being in a group.
-If you are having problems logging in
date: sometimes you have to bypass steam and load the game's .exe(don't forget your password after you make the account). I also had to completly remove AVG off of my rig as it had conflicts with Tera.\n\nIf you have the free time

reviewText:
I cannot recommend this game to anyone but the casual players. If you enjoy the combat system and the average storyline, this Tera will be fun. However, if you want to have any motivation to play this game after reaching max level, look to another MMORPG. This game is completely unbalanced and unrewarding in the endgame content.

There's two major things to do in the end game, dungeons and PvP. Regarding PvP, most of the battlegrounds are equalized so one doesn't need gear to compete in them. You do need crystals and some other consumables, but that's all. Therefore, there is no reason to get any new gear or run the dungeons unless you want to play 1v1 matches. Yet, the 1v1 matches are completely skewed towards certain classes. This was done intentionally to have peope switch classes and purchase the new cash shop items. Then there's lag and desync that makes it hard and unfufilling to PvP at all.

PvE content is also skewed towards the same classes, as Brawler can tank an instance and do almost double the damage of an average DPS with the same gear. All of the older classes are completely inferior in every way for all the PvE content. Gunner in dungeons don't even have to move or worry about health, as they have a bot that heals them and high damage ranged attacks.

This game had a lot of potential, but was ruined by imbalance and cash-grabbing. In future patches, some of the issues are addressed, but as the whole the creators are not addressing the many problems in the game. As they continue to release more and more flashy classes that lag everyone to death.

reviewText:
I have been playing this game for over 2 years now, and I can honestly say its a great MMO.

The combat is exceptional, no question about it, although the questing is a bit bland and standard.

Endgame in TERA consists of mostly of PvE content. PvP content still exists, but it is nowhere near as plentiful as PvE content. Dungeons in TERA are the most challenging of any MMO I've played. The trinity system is very much alive in this game, you need to do your job and you need to be able to rely on your teamates to complete the endgame dungeons. Most of the time, if 1 party member ♥♥♥♥s up its a wipe and you will probably start all over. if you want an example of the difficulty, the most recent dungeon, Dreadspire, is a 20 floor dungeon that gets harder for each floor you ascend to. That particular dungeon has been out for 3 months and NOBODY on my server (lake of tears) has cleared it yet, not even the most geared players.

Skill does play a big factor in this game. I personally have killed players who were wearing the top PvP gear in the game by being able to play my class better than they can play theirs, all while I was wearing a lower tier of PvP gear. As an example that this is possible here is a video of a player wearing a low tier of PvE gear killing a player wearing top tier PvP gear.

Is this game pay 2 win? No not really. You can spend real money to buy costumes, mounts, RNG boxes, etc from the cash shop, and them sell those for in game gold to players. Personally, because of the fact that everything from the cash shop except cosmetics are easily available in game, and gold is easily obtainable, I do not consider this pay2win.Does this game sexualize females? Sure it does, but before you go all SJW on my ♥♥♥ take into account that males are sexualized just as much as females in this game, and there are plenty of costumes available in game or via cash shop that arent very revealing. That whole argument is pretty stupid, grow the ♥♥♥♥ up tumblr.Is leveling boring? It honestly depends on how you level. You can hit the level cap in 24 hours if you grind it out, but its not as enjoyable as questing and clearing dungeons. I DO NOT reccommend using one of the level 58 scrolls, because you will be at a disadvantage. Think of 1-65 as a giant tutorial on how to play your class, if you skip all that you will end up getting your ♥♥♥ kicked. Is this game grindy? Sure it is, but compared to games like archeage, the grind is nothing. Its a korean MMO, so expect RNG and grind. Personally I like it, because I EARN my gear. The grind in this game rewards you well, and you feel like you acomplished something worthwhile after you reach your goal.Is crafting important? Yes, very. Crafting is expensive to max out, but once you do it is a great way to make money, and the only way some endgame gearsets are made. Of course crafting itself is pretty standard, youbuy a recipe, learn it, gather all the mats, and auto craft the item at a forge.
This game is not for everybody, but if you try it out I implore you to stick with the game at least a week after hitting the level cap. This is one of those MMOs that opens up at endgame, and a chunk of players give up at lvl 40-50. Also remember that your class will be slow and clunky at first, but will become more fast and fluid at level cap.

reviewText:
This is the only MMO that has ever been able to keep my attention.

You don't target the enemy and then play the keyboard dance to win. This plays like an action game. Your reflexes, reactions, and knowledge of enemy attacks and movements are what keeps you alive.

After having created (Edit) 4 level 65 characters I give this game a big thumbs up.

A lot has changed since I joined near the end of P2P Tera. 99.9% of which has been for the best. Events are fun, (real-world) money is not needed to progress, each class has a definite and unique (fun) playstyle.

Update: The endgame grind has actually been down managed, and continues to move in this direction. As someone who worked hard to +15 a set of gear last season, I'm actually ok with this. Awakening gear was such a firm pain in the butt, and now it's more manageable. If you walked away from this game out of anger in the past, now (especially with the awesome brawler class) would be a good time to pick it back up.

reviewText:
I've been playing TERA for a little over a month now, but I'm no new player to MMORPG's.
I've spent thousands of hours over various MMO's over the years, and now I've settled on this.
I currently have a level 65 Reaper, level 65 Gunner, a level 60 and a level 40 Archer.
Like any MMORPG's, this game requires time commitment and a willingness to communicate.
I'd like to go through the pros and cons of this one.

CONS:
1) PK - If you choose to play on a PvP server, there may be high levels hunting down low levels at many times throughout your leveling experience. Though very annoying, these individuals do not reflect the majority of the community. You can simply avoid being PK'd by switching channels.
2) Gear Carry - In the end game PvP, outside of equalized arenas, gear plays a HUGE factor in your success. The difference between a +15 and +12 set of gear can be immense. On the bright side, most of the massive PvP options are equalized, meaning each persons gear equalize to a norm, and in those match ups, only skill matters.
3) RNG - Like any Korean MMORPG, there is A LOT of RNG involved. Be that good or bad, is entirely up to you.

PROS:
1) The World - My first play through of the story line and journey through the world was gorgeous. I've played my share of MMO's, and this one, by far, is the most beautiful I've ever seen. If your computer can handle the max settings on graphics, then definitely do it. Each region has it's own theme, and each skill you use has it's own impactful feeling.
2) The Combat - The combat in this game is something else. No more standing around smacking the boss and hoping for a crit. No more rock-paper-scissors PvP. The combat in this game is all anticipations and reactions. Even during bosses that you've fought hundreds of times, you'll still find yourself dying, as you misinterpret an action, or misstep a dodge. Needless to say, the PvP is very skill based as well. If you're looking for a slow and boring combat system, this game is NOT for you.

Overall, I would definitely recommend this game to my buddies.
The early levels may be hard, but the end game is worth it.
40 vs 40 open world Guild vs. Guilds, just spontaneously happening everywhere. Defend/Siege Castle PvP matches. Hunting down outlaws in openworld.
For those more interested in PvE, I don't know what to tell you, as I am personally a fan of PvP.

reviewText:
TERA is a dynamic game where you have to pay alot of attention.
Unlike most other MMORPGs, it requires you to dodge, block and counter attacks, aim properly and just be constantly moving in general. This makes the game more skill based; It doesn't matter how strong your gear is if you're not utilizing it properly. The visuals are fantastic for an MMORPG that was released in 2011 and I personally am a huge fan of the race as well as armor designs. The game does a good job at supporting new players and leveling up from 1 to 65 will never feel grindy or tedious unless you're a solo priest (sob). You have a lot of freedom over how you want to level up, there are many ways as soon as you hit level 22.

Once you reach the endgame content, things will start to get very grindy (as it should be). Gear will start to get more difficult to obtain as you have long cooldowns on the 5-man 65 instances (at least 5 hours) and getting the materials to improve said gear will not be a cakewalk either. These endgame instances can be very intense and overwhelming on your first runs. They require everyone in the party to fulfill their role properly. Even if you're just a damage dealer, you're actively screwing over everyone by not dealing enough damage. You need to know how to rotate your skills to deal the highest possible amount of damage. I advise you to always look up guides and watch videos first before you decide to run a 65 instance as inexperienced people will not only be frustrated from being one shotted over and over but aggravate the entire party too. Finding a PVE guild that supports new players and helps them gear up is the best way to face the endgame, so join one if you can. Having a static party in general is far better than being matched with random players. Unfortunately I cannot say much about PvP as I am more of a PVE guy but I found a short series of pictures[imgur.com] that sum it up rather well.

This game has a cash shop, so of course that makes you wonder: Is it P2W?
The answer is: Absolutely not.
I love the way they handled their game going F2P and other devs should take note of this.
The cash shop allows you to buy mounts, costumes etc. which don't influence your stats or skills in any way.
You can also buy an elite status membership which gives you a gold and EXP boost, more instance runs as well as some other convenient goodies but it's not really worth the money.
The only advantage that players which spend money on this game have over players that don't is that they have an easier way to make gold fast (by selling those cosmetics). However, there are many ways to amass a fortune without even paying a cent once you hit 65, so it's not a big deal.

I used to play on EU and this is the only MMORPG that ever had me hooked (I've played MANY).
I highly recommend this to anyone that is sick of static combat that forces you to get hit.

Add me if you're playing on Lake of Tears and have questions: Kud

reviewText:
First and foremost Tera is a game that requires you to be good at your chosen class. The experience you have largely depends on you putting some work into learning your skills and how you aim and time them. Playing solo you can challenge yourself to some extemely tough content or you can party up and have a relaxed playthrough of the exact same content. Combat is really satisfying once you have developed your skill against players or PvE content.

Visually Tera is really nice and the music is excellent too. I'm not too fond of the voice acting but I'm one of those people who doesn't like anime dubbed into English either. En Masse have worked hard on optimisation but Tera's performance seems to be inconsistant and is CPU bound so to get 60fps it took me a while to get the right settings. Some people have no issues with performance - it's just something you may need to be aware of.

I find all the classes to be fun to play, but I do have issues with some of the races you can chose due to the dodge and jump animations being different between races. Tera also comes from the 'less is more' school of gaming where a lot of the armour is heavily sexualised but I play zoomed out to the max distance so it isn't an issue for me. If you play as a Castanic Female for example you'll spend a lot of time watching ♥♥♥♥ that you'll either find it comical or off putting.

I've played on the North American version of Tera for a while now despite being from the EU. I've never had a positive experience with Gameforge (the EU publisher of Tera) so I was really happy when En Masse's version of Tera came on steam because steam makes in game purchases easy. En Masse's customer service is a credit to the gaming industry too. There are still physical copies of Tera available to buy from Amazon (make sure they're unopened and published by En Masse) that give you loads of content you would normally have to pay for; En Masse still honour the codes from these physical versions and if you input the code backwards you get additional content; worth baring in mind if you try and like Tera enough to warrant a purchase.

reviewText:
8.5/10 Overall

The game is mostly fun, no major complaints. Zero pay2win structure, so that's a plus. Paying helps, kinda, but nothing you can't earn with in game gold in a reasonable time frame. Class balance is somewhat chess-like in PvP and PvE: X is better than Y, and Y is better than Z, etc. The devs do a decent job listening to players and trying to add balance to play.

Pros:
+Aim to hit, no tank and spanks.
+Class variety is legitimate
+PvP requires skill
+Skill cap is high on all classes
+iFrames (Invulnerable Frames) on some moves
+Cosmetics are vast and amazing

Cons:
-Elite" status is over priced
recommended:
but too be expected
-PvP isn't parsed to level ranges
-Quests are back and forth running
-The switch to F2P seems to have ruined pacing on the story as you out level areas way too fast

Overall

reviewText:
All style no substance.

Short version: This is a Korean MMO. For those with MMO experience that should tell you everything you need (you are either into Korean MMOs or Not; if not, run far far away).

Edit: note that the .5 game time tracked is because I shut down steam when I play. I hadn't even thought about it tracking my hours played, I put about 20 or so hours into this simply because I'd heard good things from various people (including my neighbor IRL) and I kept hoping maybe the game would get better. (in comparison I have no problem putting in 100s or even 1000s of hours into legit good MMOs

Long version:

I can see how this game may appeal to certain kinds of players. It's a decent looking game that runs on minimal hardware and if you can stomach the shallow storylines the combat is mildly entertaining in short play sessions.

The problems however run the typical list of Korean short comings:
1. terrible storylines: Yea some of the cut scenese are respectable but those are few and far between; the bulk of missions you do will be your standard fetch quest and kill list variety in the brain dead style of oh you want me to find X and it's 3 feet to your left?".

2. Linear world: if you stay on the path you will walk straight into everything you need to do
date: oh and you pretty much can't walk off the path so don't worry you don't need to think at all.\n\n3. Zero challenge of any kind: Sure it's an "innovative combat" system for an MMO
recommended: too bad it's super baby easy mode. Honestly I got to level 20 or so and hadn't been hit by an enemy yet. Read that again: I'm not saying I hadn't died yet... I had not been HIT yet. Apparantly "active dodge" system means you can just keep kiting forever and the mobs never figure out how to hit you. I'm not saying an MMO needs to be hard
hoursPlayed: but this didn't even feel like I was playing. I was just kinda walking down a path watching stuff die occasionally.\n\n4. Cheap boss moves: So when the game bothers to pretend it's going to offer you a challenge (oh look a boss fight!)
voteText: yea that's not what this is. Instead what you get is the standard easy fight + 1 super cheat move. You spend most of the fight dodging
helpfulPercent: not getting hit
votesHelpful: plinking away at a boss that has 10x the hp of the normal mobs and than does his cheat move. You get warped to in front of him (no matter where you are
votesTotal: no dodge)
votesFunny: stunned in place for a while and slowly watch as he hits you with whatever special move he has. Insert boring long ♥♥♥ animation to show you that you were hit by something undodgable while you twiddle your thumbs with no buttons to push (because you are stunned for so long)\n\nThat's not interesting combat
commentsCount: that's terrible AI followed by a cheat move followed by terrible AI. In the end you will beat the boss the same as you beat anything else with no real challenge other than that one move that you cant dodge.\n\n5. Clunky interface: 1999 called
column16: it wants it's MMO interface back.\n\n6. Indecipherable crafting system ~ granted maybe I didn't play long enough to figure it out
column17: but what I did see felt like a mash up of every bad Korean crafting system I've seen before.\n\n7. Gender locked classes: I don't think I'd care about this one if they made sense in storyline. I mean you name something a Valkyrie and sure you kind of expect those to all be female; but that's not how it is in Tera. Instead you get most of the classes (and all of the newer ones including "brawler") that are female only
column18: some of them are race and gender specific. Not because the storyline demands it but because the dev team doesn't feel like creating the models for other races/genders to be those things. It looks like lazy development
column19: it feels like lazy development and when you read their dev blogs they basically admit the same.\n\n8. Somethings lost in translation. While it's not entirely broken Engrish there is definately something lost in translation. Much of what you hear/read while playing is either extremely generic or just slightly "off". One quest line (that goes on for several missions) is all about "the children
column20: the children
column21: wont someone think of the children"
column22: but you're pretty much saving "one girl"
column23:
that's not children (it's a child... you don't know this?) and please stop quoting me drivel like "someone think of the children".

So many more missions go on like that with poor word choices and blanket platitudes that don't always fit the situation. If you like being hit over the head with platitudes this may be the game for you.

8. It's not as inovative as it pretends to be. 5 minutes into playing this and my first impression was "this is really watered down first person shooter mechanics shoved into an MMORPG shell". A couple of hours later my opinion hadn't changed.

9. It's free2play ~ This is both good and bad. If you are a 13 year old with no money
column24: this may be the game for you. If however you are an adult that can afford to spend money
column25: please spend it somewhere else. This game is a huge money sink and you get very little out of it. I had a pile of boxes in my inventory by the time I was done that all would require real money to open. After some google searches I came to realize that what I'd get from those boxes is random crap in the hope of something good. But you get so many it's a constant "please give me money". Look
column27:
devs need money to make games and I'll throw cash at good games all day long. But with a game this shallow I really don't want to be begged for money constantly.

Honestly this felt like one of those free2play games where newbs sit around begging for cash in the starting city spamming you non stop except its the devs doing it here. Put some of that energy into making the game decent and maybe I'd have incentive to pay you.

10. The grind
column29: the endless grind. If you've played Korean MMOs before you know what I mean. There's nothing different here. It's grind or go home.\n\n11. Stupid loot system. Every mob you kill drops crap all over the place. Every kill you make becomes a tedios explosion of individual items to pick up one at a time. God forbid you kill a group of mobs all at once
column30: can you just loot once and pick up everything? Nope
column31: you get to walk around picking up each individual item. It's almost a (bad) mini-game unto itself. Annoying busy work is what it really is.\n\n12. The community is terrible. You're in a game where most of the classes are gender locked but the idiots who play are too immature to not pick on each other about it. "I bet you're not a real girl" leads to one fight after another after another into endless loops of childish tantrums in general chat. Like seriously if you wanted to play a gunner or a brawler you HAD to pick female
column32: there was no other choices. This basically amounts to "you must be homosexual if you played tomb raider because the main character there is female and thats for girls".\n\nI really felt like I was surrounded by little kids who think the epitomy of conversation is "neener neener pants on fire" and quite frankly that would have been an upgrade from most of the pointless trash talk. There wasn't even a reason to trash talk
column33: they were just too bored of the game so they sit around picking on each other for something to do.\n\nI could go on
column34: but you either get the point by now or you don't. I've played memorable Korean MMOs before (Aion comes to mind)
column35:
but this one falls on the heap of crap I hope I don't remember by tomorow (along with 100s of other forgettable Korean MMOs). But I'm pretty sure most of the development budget was spent on making nice looking boobs and not on making a decent game.

In summary:
The game is a bad first person shooter combined with a mediocre RPG and slapped with a label of "Look at me I innovated". No you really didn't
column36: you took a big steaming dump on the MMO universe and than bragged about it as if no one else takes big steaming dumps. At least I have the courtesy to leave mine in the toilet."

reviewText:
+ Combat is decently interactive
+ Graphics, sound, and music boast a decent production value
+ Has the occasional cinematic for main quest lines
+ Some fairly provocative fantasy armor and character designs for both men AND women
+ Dragon people

- Heavy dependence on gear, rather than skill or stat choices of the character (with the exception of Glyphs)
- Grindy, without much substance or involved/cohesive plot
- Crafting and gathering are throttled by an account-wide 'point' system that regenerates with time
- Awkward blend of modern items/costumes/concepts in high fantasy setting
- Character customization leaves much to be desired/is behind a cumbersome pay-to-win wall
- Outrageous development-trend bias (special classes for MOST POPULAR races, ie: elin, female elves and castanic; extensive wardrobe specially for these races; retcon of female amani foot/leg anatomy with many costumes)
- Elin and popori... Really?
- Crashy servers
- Very heavy CPU usage
- Game relies on unique character names, without global handles for player accounts (hard to stay in touch with friends across multiple characters)
- Added to that, friends list has an 80-character limit (bumped up from 40 even)
- Private chat channels have 100-character limits (total, before server reset- NOT concurrently online)
- On top of that, private chat channels are wiped at server reset, and can not be administered after creation.
- Guilds have 300-character limits

RECOMMENDATION?
It's fun, to extents. There is incredible room for improvement in this game. Its current design does not convince me that it was created to handle a truly MMO-scale player base. Worse yet, I am not convinced that its developers 'get' what makes an MMO viable nowadays, at least in the Western market.

For every positive aspect I find in it, I find two more that are negative. Since Steam doesn't have an inconclusive" option for recommendation
date: I'm going to have to go with "No.""

reviewText:
I've played TERA on and off since the open beta, 3 years ago.
The comunity kind of went on a downwards spiral after free to play, and global chat is probally the most useless thing in the world now.
But the game is still worth playing if you can find a guild you enjoy playing with,
With the luanch of the new server I transfered for free (availible for one week) and am Enjoying the game again.
Back on topic.

I'f youve tried Wildstar, Guild wars 2, Or Neverwinter Online the Combat in this game is very simular.
Here is a few things about tera.
- It is not forgiving to being out of position if you are playing sloppy your party will know
- Survival in a dungeon is based on skill, dodges, blocks, and invulnerable frames keep you alive.
- Healing isn't point and click, But it's still boreing" if your party is not taking damage.
- TERA is faster paced then alot of the Action combats and keeps you on your toes.
- The game takes into account where you are in the fight. with bonus damage from behind and other mechanics
- Enchanting takes a lot of effort at level cap. but you can /farm/ the items (or buy them with cash to save time.)

I Personally feel once you have played tera you won't enjoy any other MMO. I know that I haven't been able to play any other MMO since tera

reviewText:
I was really excited when they decided to release Tera on Steam because this game is SO MUCH FUN! One of the best MMOs, in my opinion. I will say, however, that it's better to play with friends just because grinding can get boring really fast and waiting for a party to form to enter dungeons can take a lifetime. Like seriously, no joke.

One thing I really love about the game would have to be the character customization. I gotta admit, I'm a sucker for good character customization. There's a big selection to choose from, so you'll definitely find something to fit your style. The only thing about it that I dislike would have to be how some of your choices impact other features...like, a certain hairstyle comes with a specific eye color (which you can't change, if you wanted to) - beauty features, such as makeup, can also change the eye color, so it's just something that you'll have to work with.

As for the gameplay, it's not complicated at all. Even people new to the whole mmorpg scene will quickly get used to the controls. The battles are like any other open world mmo, but it's all about your character's class that will make it more exciting (especially when you're testing out new skills). Also, running while in battle is significantly slower, so if you bit off a little more than you could chew and decided to flee, then prepare for the slowest retreat of your life (at least until battle mode disappears). And don't forget, when you're running through the open world, to take some time to appreciate your surroundings because the graphics are quite nice too :)

Now, about the community... it doesn't seem bad, but it's not all that great either. Honestly, it seems a bit difficult to make friends on here, mostly because people are off doing their own thing. Like I mentioned earlier, it's more fun to play with friends in this game; so I can assume that's what most people are doing in Tera, instead of going through the hassle of hunting people down to make friends. Playing solo isn't necessarily bad either, I suppose, so long as you don't succumb to boredom quickly. If none of your friends play Tera and you don't want to play solo, there are groups that you can join on Steam where people would be more than happy to join you.

Overall, I really love this game and it's quickly become one of my go-to MMOs. The gunner class is just amazing, so if you're curious about it then I'd definitely recommend trying it out (especially if you like blowing ♥♥♥♥ up)! If you're thinking about playing Tera, I'd say go for it - it's free, fun, and there are always new and exciting updates for you to enjoy :)

reviewText:
Tera is an interesting Free to Play MMORPG from a Korean developer.
Tera uses True Action Combat,  instead of Tab Targeting, meaning you have to aim your attacks, dodge enemy attack and time your attacks.
Has sexy and cute looking female and male avatars, plenty of skills and combos, 7 races, 9 classes.  Plenty of ways to improve your avatars performance with gear and specialization, cosmetics and customization to change looks, Pets and Mounts.  The game has great graphics.

The different races looks vary greatly providing variety and satisfying many tastes.  The universe has a japanese anime feel, reminding me of Final Fantasy game crossed with Dungeon and Dragons.  It is easy and quick to solo level and has group content.  Has PVE- Roleplay and PVP servers. Has crafting.
Does not look pay to win at beginning.  Store has plenty to sell you.  Some classes are gender and race locked.  Free players have 2 slots per server but able to make avatars on each server.  Might run out of bank space if you are a packrat or a crafter, forcing you to pay store for bank space.  Has a free working mount.

Give this game a try.

reviewText: Been playing this game long before It went steam and man is it fun. Been a couple years and have a few lvl 65's now and it still puts a smile on my face in PvP, and PvE is still challenging even with the right gear, The game is challenging with the true action combat, keeps you on your toes. If a boss enrages and is about to slam the ground, you either jump out of the way with dodge skill, or your 1 shot dead. Thats endgame of course, the earlier bosses along the way+ BAM's train you along the journey to 60/65.\nThis game is NOT pay to win. It has a cash shop that deals with mostly cosmetic items/mounts and such. You do get bonus xp from being elite member, but you can also just buy an XP scroll on the broker with in game gold for super cheap. One of the best F2P experiences ive ever dealt with. I play free for years and have a blast! I do reccommend for people finding a niche after WoW like I did. Fantastic game, PvP anyone you want go outlaw and have fun lol, If you dont like that, you can always join a PvE server. C:\nEndgame keeps me active as well, Working to not only get better gear, but competing as a guild For crusade high scores in the server keeps me coming back to prove we are the best! Got to get the Guild Exclusive skycastle that floats outside major cities =D

reviewText: Tera is a good mix of modern beautiful graphics, decent storyline and wonderful sounds. It strives to be a great MMO. Its intro island and story-line are more than adequate. The graphics are truly excellent, beholding at times. The sound effects and music are great. The quests are standard MMO fair, with some twists. The dungeons are logical and storyline quests tie into each one. Sometimes you get there before you have quests, which is fine. The UI and such are good - makes most of efficiencies I would say. Broker/Auction house is pretty nifty, clean and well laid out. The cities are beautiful as are the forests, deserts and snowy areas. As you level, you have villages that act as quest hubs. It pairs with the story line and works out rather well. There are more than enough quests to level. Healing, Tanking and DPS are all well represented here.\n\nOverall, a truly amazing game and I definitely recommend it.

reviewText: An absolutely beautiful game with the most fun combat I have ever seen in an mmorpg. You need a really good graphics card to get the best experience, but you can still play it decently with a not so great graphics card.  The crafting isn't that great, but it was never a strong point of the game to begin with. The videos they have to show off the combat just don't do it justice, you can only know the full extent of the combat when you fight a BAM solo for about 10 minutes, which is rediculously fun and rewarding. Combine all that with the fact that the whole thing is free, no pay walls or pay to win gear anywhere, and you have the best deal since $0.50 corndogs at Sonic. Anyone who doesn't atleast try out this game is missing out big time.

reviewText:
I haven't had much experience with MMO's other than Tera, I dabbled in a few others, but none stuck with me until Tera. I first started playing when Wonderholme was the new instance. Note I play on a PvE server. This game is F2P and most of the items you can purchase with real money is only cosmetic. Though if you do subscribe and get Elite Status, or buy consumables it helps a lot. Though it isn't needed and not that noticeable unless if you plan to tunnel vision into this game. In that case having Elite helps a lot, being able to have more production points (gathering, crafting) and being able to run instances more than the average user (some instances have a time limit until you can run it again)

Pros:The combat is amazing. It is the defining feature for most that play and think of Tera. It truly makes you feel powerful. It makes killing mobs really fun. With a ♥♥♥♥ load of skills and depth for each class it's possible you can never get bored of just playing one.

This game's pvp is one of the most dynamic I've ever seen, Gear matters a lot, but so does skill. An under geared character can easily take out a better geared one if the difference skill is great enough. though lag and net code can hinder this at times. D-sync can also be pretty frustrating as well.

Customization of characters, with numerous costumes and races it's not hard to make a character that you'd truly enjoy. (Who doesn't want to decimate mobs as a kawaii loli?)

This game is beautiful. With the numerous environments, dungeons and more. This game is truly eye candy. (If your pc can run it, the lower/lowest settings are okay, but nothing special ofc)

Dungeon design is fantastic. Each dungeon is fun and unique with monsters and bosses with different mechanics.

Variety of mobs, monsters and enemies. There's so many different things to kill in this game. There's small minions to BAMS(Big ♥♥♥ Monsters) and the design is truly fantastic

If lore is your thing, than the lore of Tera is really imersive. The wonderful environments doesn't hurt.

Cons:This game can be pretty harsh to newcomers, especially in instances and pvp. But this can be said of any game.

Unless lore is your thing (for most that play mmos it isn't), leveling is pretty boring and typical of a mmo. Typical kill a # of mob quests, the occasional escort quest, go to point a to point b to talk to some dude, and having the dungeon be the end of a quest arc, etc.

The endgame is expensive(in in game currency, not real) and extremely grindy. You don't have to spend money to succeed in the game. but expect to run the same dungeons and dailies over and over again to get enough mats, points, etc. to make your end game gear. The grind is real. If you're truly dedicated, be expected to put in a ♥♥♥♥ load of hours, as expected of a Korean MMO

Unless if you're really into pvp there isn't much to do after you have achieved your desired endgame gear. Do you expect to run the dungeons you've been running countless time to get your endgame gear? Most people get sick of the grind before they get there.

Solo play. For those who like to play solo, you can solo up to the max level with no trouble, but after that you really need to be in a guild to succeed in the endgame.

reviewText:
Eh... it gets boring... fast....
It is fun for a while, but it's more of an on and off again game for me.
I would give it a thumbs up but there is so much about this game thatannoys me to high hell.
I've been playng for quite a while, 4+ max level characters. all of them with good gear, one with current gear.
I'm in one of the top guilds with our own sky castle, annnnnnd I have played this ganme religiously.

What I hate the most about it is no matter how much work you put into this game, it will still shoot you in the foot.
You can grind for weeks or even month's and still come out with nothing but 2nd rate gear in the end.
I do not mind at all the grind for good gear, in fact I love it. I love having gear that only truly dedicated players can obtain. But then it comes down to making it worth while by enchanting it.
+9... is annoying for top tier gear.
+12, is a joke when it comes to how high the failure rate is....
+15? You might as well buy the damn equip from another player with how often this will fail on you.
have failed over 90 tries from +12 to +13.
Let's calculate that... 1 try is 100 MWA (you'll know these terms once you get to know the game.) + 200 feedstock.
MWA goes for around 29-35 gold each.
Feedstock goes for around 7-10 (at the time)
So 29-35 times 100, and 7-10 times 200 TIMES 90 FAIL'S which do NOT give any materials back.
You can definitely DEFINITELY farm all of the above, and that is where the weeks to months of grinding statement comes into play. Allll of that work, time, dedication, and n some cases money for those who think I'm going to make this a sure thing and invest a bit of money in the game to get more materials from other players so i can have even more of a chance of success!!!" only to see that 9 fail's go to 120 quickly...
Don't believe me? Look it up
recommended: and material's farmed over the course of weeks and months gone down the drain.\n\nNow I understand making things difficult and not so easy
hoursPlayed: but to make the game fail THAT much where it's become the norm when people put so much time and effort into your game? That is a slap in the face to the players in my eyes.\nNow it definitely makes you feel awesome when you're walking around with that +15 let me tell you!
voteText: but it's.... just not worth it... at all...\nBecause you know what? 6-7 months later
helpfulPercent: a new set is out and you have to do it alllllllllll over again. And your luck could be better this time around
votesHelpful: or even worse!!!\nI've seen cases where they had over 160 tries to get just to +13!\nThere should be a guarantee after a certain number
votesTotal:
seriously. That is TOO much required player dedication for one patches equips that are going to be obselete sooner than later.

And the community.... is... just... a virus...
I don't get involved with them much myself because I generally do not care

reviewText: Finally! This is quite possibly the best MMO I've played so far (definitely the best of the free ones). However, for quite a while now I haven't been able to play it because the launcher they made for it is terrible and downloads broken patches all the time. My game literally broke itself with the last update and I've been unable to play it since then. With it being on steam though, I am able to enjoy this game again. It seems like they might've even optimized it a little better than it used to be.\nIf you haven't played TERA before and you're looking for a solid action MMO this is a fantastic game. The combat is really fun, there are a ton of attacks, and it's damn pretty too. I've played Rift, vindictus, black gold online, the secret world, defiance, and a few others too, and this wipes the floor with all of them. I'm told it plays a lot like final fantasy XIV, but thankfully went free to play. I've never been a huge fan of the free to play model, per-say, but this game pulls it off well. The only thing that I'd like to see is some cheaper prices. 15 bucks for a mount is insane (especially since you have to spend at least 20 just to buy enough gold to get the 15 dollar mount in the first place).\nAll in all though, now that it's on steam and the launcher/patcher issues seem to have been fixed, I highly recommend this game.
voteText: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
TERA is a very immersive game  with fantastic real-time combat that encourages good planning to take down enemies accordingly, it's not a smash-all-the-keys-to-win type of game.

Questing is very clear and easy, you can skip through the conversations like it's nothing, there's a tracker that tells you what, how and where you have to do things.The game gets certainly harder as you level up but what else would one expect? it doesn't take out the fun of it.

Dying isn't really punished, other than having a chance to lose crystals (gems that improve your stats in certain ways), but they're easy to reobtain most of the time.

Finally, the best kind of female armor covers the minimum, just enough to hide their sensitive girly features, low-tier armor covers most of their bodies but they might as well be made out of paper with those stats. Also there's little girls with animal ears and tails.

reviewText: Tera  is a great free to play mmo. If you think it's like others you would be wrong. The combat system makes this game awesome the person behind the toon skills matter. Thinking about giving Tera a try stop thinking and JUST DO IT!!! You will not regret it. My wife and I has been playing for almost 200 Hours and we love it you will to.

reviewText:
I have been waiting for the Steam release for a long, looong time!

TERA has for sure the best action combat mechanic I have ever experienced so far on MMORPGs. It's pretty solid and even with high latencies (of over 180, for example) you can still experience a good gameplay against NPCs ant other players, unlike other current competitors. The combat is pretty similar to Monster Hunter's, but faster and more frenetic. Learn enemy attack patterns and properly position yourself in the battlefield are extremely necessary on end game PvE and PvP contents.

One of the few cons I have about this game is the early game, which is kinda repetitive (kill x number of monsters and so on). Most of its story is telled by texts, If the developers had properly invested on it and dubbed NPC voices it would make it waaay more attractive to players. And the game's lore is good, just need to be told in the right way.

Talking about F2P, I have been playing this game for 2 years and I can assure you that is not Pay to Win. Most of the cash shop items are just cosmetics and you can even buy them from other players on trade broker. In-game currency is kinda easy to accumulate, so no worries about losing your social life to get that so desired weapon skin.

If you are looking for an action fantasy MMORPG, that is fun on both PvE and PvP, give TERA a shot! And don't give up early, the game reeaally shines on end game content!

reviewText:
My favorite game by far.

I'm not much of an MMO player. I did play things like Mabinogi and Maplestory long time ago but I didn't even enjoy them that much-- only played it so I can play with friends. I also played a bit of WoW, GW2, Archeage, but they didn't really suit me-- either I was bad or I didn't spend much time on them.

When my friend first told me about TERA, it was pretty amazing and I liked it but I didn't really spend much time. Time passed, and I began to spend more and more time, eventually joining a large guild, obtaining diamond laurel, getting generation gear. This game get fun as long as you put your effort to get better and better-- that might be just me loving to learn more as I play though.

The story is pretty good if you manage to play through the quests. I completed them not too long ago, and I'm really excited to see what's next in the story. Gameplay however, won't really be affected by the story. If you are interested in lores, play through those red markers (except the event ones from roostock and tuwangi).

Music is decent. There are a handful of nice OST (you can go to youtube to listen to them too), but you won't really notice it majority of the time.

Graphics are pretty damn nice. It's using Unreal Engine 3 so the game can be said it's a bit old. Environment/entities look really nice in this game for free to play (it used to be pay to play back in 2012). Really, one thing that pulled me to play this was the graphics.

Now, the community isn't as bad as they seem, it's just that there are some trolls here and there but there are a lot of friendly people out there so don't be shy to ask on global.

Only bad thing I want to say though, if you have high ping, it's really hard to play. Also there are known framedrops and such due to bad UI, several lags here and there, but those won't really affect combat unless you open inventory or other UI.

reviewText:
One of the best MMOs out there, and it is free so there is no reason not to try it. Highly recommend for any fans of MMO/RPGs. Great with friends or solo.

+Free to play, no major advantages paywalled
+Great visuals for environments, characters, enemies, voiced cutscenes
+Plenty of adjustable settings for visuals, fps, and UI
+Action-style combat flows well and a change of pace from most MMOs
+Variety of races and classes to choose from
+Leveling occurs at a good pace
+Solo friendly, even group dungeons can be done solo

-Several classes are gender or race-locked, or both.
-Crafting doesn't seem worthwhile before possibly endgame
-Some minor bugs/development oversights like not being able to climb down ladders

reviewText:
One of the first things I noticed about TERA was how great the F2P model is. In a time where a lot of games are using pay-to-win microtransactions to make money, this game does not seem to be reliant on in-game purchases to be a powerful character. This makes the game especially enjoyable for anyone not interested in playing the game quite frequently enough to justify (or afford) a subscription.
Another great feature of TERA is the animation style. I was never a fan of the cartoon-y style that several MMOs have adopted (such as WoW and Rift), and fell in love with the graphics in this game. The game has much more realistic graphics than many other games, and the overall texture quality is pretty high; while this is a good thing for people with high-end computers, cheaper computers will have to sacrifice a lot of image quality to avoid lag, etc. The game does have diverse graphics options, however, so users can make their own choices about that.
As other players have mentioned, this game adopts a targeting system different than many MMOs. In TERA, character positioning is much more important because both npcs and players have to aim their attacks. This aspect gives a nice little change in a genre of games that typically are very similar.
My only real complaint with the game is the sexualization of characters. Amour can't be very effective when a majority of a character's chest is exposed, so clothing styles often feel out of place/unnecessary. Unfortunately, this trend is becoming increasingly common with games, but TERA does have less inappropriate clothing than many other games (and is not exclusive to female characters).

reviewText:
Lord of the Rings Online (LOTRO) anyone?  Same mechanics here.  Map, character builds, enemies, potions, weapon upgrades...if you've done LOTRO, you'll fast pick up this game.  But this is *not* LOTRO.  It is the the LOTRO if Tolkien had a great eye for sexy bodies and was slightly perverted, but wanted his monsters HUGE.

F2P.  Not really a F2W.  Spoiled children can buy their way to rank, but you can earn your way up very quickly and for free.  You'll be better with your weapon and defensive skills by earning your way up.

GET TO THE DUNGEONS!   The missions are a slow, fun way to learn at first.  About level 14-20, you want to figure out how to get to the dungeons.  Even if you don't Youtube games to learn, use YOUTUBE in this game to learn the old style commands that help you join dungeons and communicate with others, join a guild, etc.  But the dungeons give you hig armor and fast rank from kills, and you meet many new players that way.

And this game is SEXY.  Very sexy (sometimes disturbingly so, but not overly disturbing - just enough to make you worry *for* the other person).  You'll screenshot your way through the game, guy or girl.  We all look good in this world, and who wouldn't love that?

7/10 for people who have never done a MMOLG.  9/10 if you've played LOTRO in the past.

HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.

reviewText:
Okay, to set one thing straight this is just an opinion based review, and its based on my personal experience.

TERA is a fun game in its way, not to mention its a good looking game. That being said if you dont start on the proper server then you will begin to hate this game. I Say this because they have 4 server types. Role Play, PvP Role Play, PvE and PvP. If your a new player then DO NOT play on the PvP server. As a matter of fact, do not play on the pvp server at all. I say this because when you get to Lumber town, and Crescentia, you will be killed by Player Killers. YOU WILL BE KILLED not you MAY you WILL, because every PKer in that area is at least level 40-64 and they will one hit kill you with an ability. If your going there early game for the story quest dont be shocked to be killed a million times over by pkers. After that the PKers die down, then you get to the level 50 area. that is when the PKers return, and this time, they travel in parties! YAY!!!

I liked the game, however my experiance was from starting in the PvP server. Pkers will show up with red names, so you can TRY to avoid them however you will just run into another, especially near Crescentia. And when you see a red name player, run to a camp or town until they leave, because even if you have pvp off, they can still attack you. All in all from my prior experience i cannot say that I would reccommend it, that being said i have been int he RP server and its fine, aside from the cancerous chat. Oh speaking of dont bother with chat, especially world chat, because all you will see in world chat is cancer and people smexing one another...

Another Thing i would like to point out is that once you get into the high lever areas, say 50-64, it is impossible to ♥♥♥♥ing level up without spending real money to get the XP boosters. That was another thing that drove me away, once you get to high level areas, the grind is real, and that isnt including the grind required to PROGRESS IN THE QUESTS.

The game is fun, its just the cancerous chat systems, and the horrendous grind late game without xp boosters that I dislike. That and the fact that Lighting Enrichment sucks up so much cpu i cant even run the game good with lighting enrichment on. Anyway, Don't be shy to try the game on the PvE server or the PvE RP server, be prepared for alot of ERP though.

reviewText: I am happily surprised by what Tera has to offer. I've played many MMO's, and while Tera has that beautiful Asian MMO look it also has a decent story line to it as well. While most Asian MMO's tend to simply be grind fests that get repetetive really fast, Tera tends to be more fast paced, netting you levels and gear rather quickly until you hit level sixty, then the wall comes up and the grind begins. It's still enjoyable even after sixty though, the quests are repetetive but the text and story is interesting. If you're looking for a gorgeous MMO thats fairly easy on the learning curve I would suggest giving Tera a shot.

reviewText: I am happily surprised by what Tera has to offer. I've played many MMO's, and while Tera has that beautiful Asian MMO look it also has a decent story line to it as well. While most Asian MMO's tend to simply be grind fests that get repetetive really fast, Tera tends to be more fast paced, netting you levels and gear rather quickly until you hit level sixty, then the wall comes up and the grind begins. It's still enjoyable even after sixty though, the quests are repetetive but the text and story is interesting. If you're looking for a gorgeous MMO thats fairly easy on the learning curve I would suggest giving Tera a shot.
voteText: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText: First off it's a fun game, very addicting, and it is legitimately free to play. They give you the option to pay for stuff, but it's more of a convenience than a necessity to win. I've taken the time to look through the items on the store, and honestly everything on there was more aesthetic or account based than it was this helps you win the game. The majority of items were character accessories and mounts, and a few things for your account like an additional character slot or leveling packs. The only thing that might be considered a little pay to win is the fact that they gave you the option to automatically level a character to level 60 by spending cash. I found that pretty interesting, it didn't seem like it would help too much unless you had friends willing to help you get gear and money, or you already had the necessities for the character, but to each their own. I personally enjoy the time spent leveling my character makes it feel more satisfying than paying basically $50 to get a character to level 60 with no work, that's just my personally preference. The only thing I might consider buying is a permanent mount that can be used by any character on my account\n\nI'm a gamer on a budget so finding this game was ideal for me. All in all the game is more than worth a try. Great graphics fun game mechanics and good diversity in classes, and daily rewards for playing make you want to play it everyday. I've seen reviews bashing the fps style of play, but I enjoy the change I feel more in control of my character. The fps style action is different, but honestly makes the game better and stand out against its competitors. If you are a fan of 3rd person shooters you can definitely get into this game. It might be a little slow paced compared to a 3rd person shooter, but for a mmo with this style of gameplay it's fairly fast paced. I can easily spend an entire day questing or grinding, and still feel like the combat is fresh and innovative. Tera breathes new life into the mmo genre and I honestly hope other developers follow the example set and make some more interesting mmos with this style of play. I have nothing against the traditional style of mmo(hardcore WoW fan), but Tera has blown me away. Give this game a try you will not be disappointed, unless you hate having fun. What are you waiting on download it, it's free! 10 out of 10

reviewText:
TL:DR:   overall this is a fun MMO that you can sink your life and time into hence I did almost failing a semester of university. A game of fantasy, magic, an absolutely beautiful world  and guys playing as small girls.  Create your perfect hero or heroine and go off and ♥♥♥♥ as much ♥♥♥♥ up as you can while helping children and the elderly to gather plants. You’ll lose your free time  and any remaining dignity  but it’ll be a fun time. This game is worth a play especially if like me you’re waiting for Black Desert to be fully released.
This… Game…. Almost failed a semester of University because I got addicted to it during the week of study before final exams.  10/10 worth it.  This game is amazing amounts of fun and it’s free. It’s really solid for a free game and I like a lot of others must ended up buying something from the store. I have 4 characters and 3 of them at the level cap, I just got so addicted to playing this game.
Positives:    This game is free. Holy crap. I would encourage anyone to at least try it for that.
Despite constantly high ping the game played just fine for me.
Pretty much everything you can buy with real money can be bought with in game gold too so if you can afford to buy stuff in game you don’t have to spend any IRL money.
I was able to create a guild called Westside Weeaboos and that’s the best thing ever.
want to be a cute elf girl?  I know I sure do. Heh.  Then this is it, create and customise your perfect doppelganger That looks nothing like the real you lol nerd
People are reasonably helpful and nice at least of PvE servers I played on. Sometimes you get some salty people when you party for end game dungeons though.   Negatives:    No servers outside of Europe and North America. I believe there used to be an Oceania server at one point but not anymore. Despite that though the game generally played very well.
A lot of busy work so things like fetch quests and kill this type quests. Which is something most MMO’s suffer from.
I don’t know if I like this or not but skill specialisations exist where you can only specialise in one thing at a time meaning you need to rely on guilds, market or friends to craft items to use in your specialisation.
Some launcher issues with the game.
(TL;DR/ Conclusion at the top)

reviewText: I was looking for something fun to play and I found Tera.This game is very fun and addictive , combat is pretty good and has a decesnt story line compared to other mmo's. There are a few things that bugged me , like there is no exp bar so i have no idea how close i am to the next level also when you have a quest to kill some boss the other players spawn kill it so you cant kill the boss to complete the quest, aslo some of the classes were super OP in my opinion , the beserker class was pertty fun to use but was pretty easy to kill high trier mobs with certain abilities, the gunner a fiarly new class is also pretty OP as i can Spawn kill bosses with it and get LOADS of exp and level up super quick. The majority of the mobs were pretty easy to kill espesialy with the beserker class , as you can knock your enemies down and spamm them with your huge axe, not sure about the other classes as i ahvent played them , but I would think they are aslo pretty powerfull in there own ways.To get some of the good loot you have to be a higher level so it just sits there in your inventory and have to gind away to get it, which is expected from any mmo. The bosses (If u can kill it before the gunnrers) are pretty easy and go down pretty quickly at the start of the game, im hoping that it gets tougher as I progress though Tera . some things that i think should be added are custom dungeons as in made fans/players, custom/workshop weapons would be pretty cool too , and custom quests or bosses. All round pretty good game , if your not into mmo's or are you should definetly give Tera a try. 10/10 in my book atleast.

reviewText:
This is a free to play MMORPG, massive multiplayer online roleplaying game. If you don't like those sorts of games I'd advise you pass on this game.

I've only played as a lowbie running quests, and so far this game does not follow the pay to win model. Alot of the things you can purchase as extras (mounts, outfits, teleports) don't appear to massively unbalance the game or penalize people that want to play for free.

This is also the first MMORPG I've encountered that lets you play with a controller. Sure you could play with controllers in other games, but that involved a mod/external program and mapping all the joystick commands. I played with both an xbox 360 controller and keyboard and mouse. I find that I like the controls better with the keyboard and mouse, but if you aren't interested in hardcore play styles the game is perfectly playable with a controller.

Graphically this game is beautiful, no complaints there.

Gameplay: Aiming matters. In this game all of your spells/attacks have to be aimed. The only other MMORPG I have ever played was world of warcraft, so this is a novel mechanic for me. I think it makes fur a fun new combat style. Aside from that, the game itself follows the standard kill x, gather y, ect to finish quests and level up.

pros: Free, controller support, unique combat style

cons: Questing gets repetitive and boring

All in all this game is worth trying out  8/10

reviewText:
I can't stand MMORPGs. Pretty much despise them. 99% of that dislike is the combat mechanic. Click the bad guy, sit back and watch until one of you dies. Click the next bad guy, hit 1, 2, 3, and watch your guy pull off combo attacks. If I wanted a game where I clicked a button then sat back  and watched things happen, I would hit a button on the remote and watch a movie. Because of my dislike of that combat, I haven't played many MMORPGs. I tried Elder Scrolls Online based on a youtube vid saying the combat was very NOT MMORPG. It wasn't bad, but when a guy starts swinging a sword at me and I run 30 feet awat, his sword should NOT still hit me! If I start swinging a sword at a guy and he runs behind me, my sword should not still hit him!

TERA. The combat still isn't perfect. Still isn't on par with an offline Elder Scrolls or Witcher, BUT you can avoid attacks, you can run away, you can MISS with a melee or ranged attack. You can fight one or two enemies, or get them aggressive towards you, run past them, and 'activate' a couple more to fight a bunch at once. As far as MMORPG combat goes, this is fluid and extremely fun!

Also, I'm not a very social person, and I've found myself having decent chats with complete strangers. The community I've experienced so far is quite friendly. It's free, you have nothing to lose by trying it, and if you've avoided MMORPGs for the same combat reasons I have, this game should leave you with a warm fuzzy feeling.

reviewText:
I can't stand MMORPGs. Pretty much despise them. 99% of that dislike is the combat mechanic. Click the bad guy, sit back and watch until one of you dies. Click the next bad guy, hit 1, 2, 3, and watch your guy pull off combo attacks. If I wanted a game where I clicked a button then sat back  and watched things happen, I would hit a button on the remote and watch a movie. Because of my dislike of that combat, I haven't played many MMORPGs. I tried Elder Scrolls Online based on a youtube vid saying the combat was very NOT MMORPG. It wasn't bad, but when a guy starts swinging a sword at me and I run 30 feet awat, his sword should NOT still hit me! If I start swinging a sword at a guy and he runs behind me, my sword should not still hit him!

TERA. The combat still isn't perfect. Still isn't on par with an offline Elder Scrolls or Witcher, BUT you can avoid attacks, you can run away, you can MISS with a melee or ranged attack. You can fight one or two enemies, or get them aggressive towards you, run past them, and 'activate' a couple more to fight a bunch at once. As far as MMORPG combat goes, this is fluid and extremely fun!

Also, I'm not a very social person, and I've found myself having decent chats with complete strangers. The community I've experienced so far is quite friendly. It's free, you have nothing to lose by trying it, and if you've avoided MMORPGs for the same combat reasons I have, this game should leave you with a warm fuzzy feeling.

reviewText:
This is a free to play MMORPG, massive multiplayer online roleplaying game. If you don't like those sorts of games I'd advise you pass on this game.

I've only played as a lowbie running quests, and so far this game does not follow the pay to win model. Alot of the things you can purchase as extras (mounts, outfits, teleports) don't appear to massively unbalance the game or penalize people that want to play for free.

This is also the first MMORPG I've encountered that lets you play with a controller. Sure you could play with controllers in other games, but that involved a mod/external program and mapping all the joystick commands. I played with both an xbox 360 controller and keyboard and mouse. I find that I like the controls better with the keyboard and mouse, but if you aren't interested in hardcore play styles the game is perfectly playable with a controller.

Graphically this game is beautiful, no complaints there.

Gameplay: Aiming matters. In this game all of your spells/attacks have to be aimed. The only other MMORPG I have ever played was world of warcraft, so this is a novel mechanic for me. I think it makes fur a fun new combat style. Aside from that, the game itself follows the standard kill x, gather y, ect to finish quests and level up.

pros: Free, controller support, unique combat style

cons: Questing gets repetitive and boring

All in all this game is worth trying out  8/10

reviewText:
I have an embarassing high amount of hours already put into this game off-steam, and I'm not sure why I even downloaded it on Steam where now it'll be public how many hours I will still put into this game.

Ugh.

Definetely one of my favorite MMOs due to the fact that there is absolutely nothing in the cash shop that you have to buy in order to play this game fully.  No fancy weapons that can one-shot people in pvp, and no armor that turns you into a god.  You can work and craft your way up and not put a single penny into this game.  Or you can farm gold and buy what you want in the broker.  Whichever your cup of tea is.  In order to be the big dog on campus, you need to combine both your physical attributes and your actual personal skills in learning and playing your class.  There isn't just one correct way, but there are many wrong ways.

Awesome combat style, overly-sexualized armor, and weapons 3 times bigger than your character, what is not to love?!

If you're into MMOs, I most certainly recommend this game be added to your collection!

reviewText:
The following are all the things i found wrong with this game so it is quite long. This was my person experience . If you do make it through all the way i salute you!

The items you get when you first start are nice. I started mine on a celebration weekend so it may be different for others. I was given some exp potions and a starter mount upon logging in, Nice right? Well little did i know it was for the first character you started with and that character only. So if you logged in and used the mount it was for that character only. Most mounts are character only from what i found out. So be careful which character you use that mount on.

-The community-
The community is the worst i have seen in any ♥♥♥♥♥♥me i have played. I met two nice people in the 136 hours i played. Yes you get those people in any game but because of the Elin character which looks like a little girl the chat is filled with people that call themselves pedo's and talk about anything sexually related to that topic. Or just sex in general.

-Dungeons-
if you dont know what your doing in dungeons forget it. No one wil help. If the group dies it will disband and you will be stuck trying to figure out how to get back in. You get teleported to the nearest town and need to buy scrolls from a speciality vendor. You wont know that if no one tells you and there expensive when you first start playing. I find having to buy scrolls to get back a horrible way to get back to the instance. I personally love going into new dungeons and trying to figure the bosses and layout of the dungeon. Well All through the game, even at higher level dungeons people do whatever they want. As a healer/tank you will have a horrible time going through these as people generally just start running the second they get into the dungeon and everyone runs different ways killing whatever they see.

-Raiding/Endgame-
If you are looking to play this game for end content or looking to raid then dont come to this game. There is no raiding or end content. You go into dungeons to get gear so you can go to other high level dungeons to get gear. That is the norm. But those higher level dungeons drop the same gear as the lower except one or two pieces. Of course you need to know the fights to get into the bigger dungeons but if you dont know them you generally will get kicked and not be given a chance. You would think you could look up the fights right? Check the next problem.

-Information about the game-
Tera also has the least amount of information i have ever seen on any game as well. Any website i go to has little to no information about fights/gear/where to get this/how to get that. You mine as well just go until you figure it out and if you cant then oh well. The chat will not help.

-Players-
Griefing. Nothing worse than someone following you around griefing. I got people all the time constantly trying to duel me. When someone duels you, anything you are doing, looking at the auction house or gear. It will take you out of that and ask if you want to duel. You can click no but they will continue to bombared you with duel invites. As far as i could see i could not find any option to turn dueling off or trading. So i had to deal with that all through my adventures through tera.

-Surviving-
There is really no way to get Hp up in this game after a fight. You have to stand there wait. yes you can have bandages and potions but if you are say at 5% hp and use both you might get to 50% hp. Then you have to wait another minute before using them again. Certainly not a efficient way to get your hp up.

-Leveling-
If you are wanting to be a healer or tank in this game then wait till you hit max level. It is quite horrible to try to level up as a tank or healer. Takes to long to kill anything and as a tank you have no heals so you go back to the problem i had above this one.

-Questing-
Questing in this game is pretty useless. Dungeons are way faster way to level up. You also get story questlines and as long as you follow the story quests and do dungeons in between you wont have to do any other quests. Though alot of the questline is annoying to get through with mazes.

-Character creation-
The character creation is ok. They certainly make the men look like a woman and the women never have anything on.
They have hitboxes for all the different characters. The woman have smaller hitboxes so your almost forced to play a woman just to make it easier.

-Powerleveling-
You cannot powerlevel in this game. Was going to help some friends level becuase they wanted to play. You get little to no xp in dungeons if you are running them through and no gear drops. They get no xp for mobs if your in a group. If you are not in a group and you help kill they do not get the kill for it so they get no exp. I really hate that they try to get rid of powerleveling.

-Addons/mods-
If you are looking for mods or addons for this game there are none. They feel that it is unfair to others Which is not true. If there are mods out there anyone can use those mods. They also do not approve of you using any addons outside the game like dps meters. If you are caught with that it is a ban.

-support-
Not a suprise, the support is bad. Everyone that had harrased me or that was horrible in the game i reported. As usual it does no good. I even put in tickets on questions i had because i could not find them anywhere else. I never got any response back. So if you need help from them You are out of luck.


-fighting/combat-
The combat in this game is really good. I found it very enjoyable that you have to be active in fighting. You cannot sit back and press a couple buttons. There are things to avoid and dodge and counter attack. You get really into it. It was probably the most enjoyable part of this game.

There are more bad/good things about this game but this review is already so long lol. I enjoyed this game in the beginning and got through all the horrible annoyances/bugs/people but once i found out that there was no endgame i stopped playing. I really really wish there was because the game itself looked so fantastic.

reviewText:
I remember seeing Tera release a few years back and giving it a pass; 'action combat' seemed like a bad idea for a what might be a stereotypical Korean 'grinder' MMO, where one spends hours and hours killing 10,000 rats. This is especially true for me as I cannot even do 'dailies' without getting terminally bored, and I'm not a fan of all the jumping about in shooters either! I much prefer a more social 'hang out with everyone on TS and raid' environment.

That and Asian games always lose something in translation to a more Western audience - and typically that something is the story.

But now we have rolled the clock forward a few years and Tera has become available on Steam for the low, low price of 'free'. So having nothing to lose I installed it... And it is actually, surprisingly, fun!

The overall combat pacing is far more involved than, say, WoW - but it is still sedate enough one can play 'for fun' without needing to invest their life in identifying attack tells to the point they are muscle memory just to survive...

Localization-wise Enmasse has done a truly wonderful job of westernizing the game world, and have managed to inject a lot of western humor into it while maintaining the general feel of the setting. It still looks Asian in the various motifs and design elements, but it is not jarring to the western eye. And the voice acting to supplant the original audio is really spot-on.

Achieving this is truly a lot harder than it sounds, and Enmasse really deserves some kudos for how well they have pulled off the localization of Tera.

Graphically Tera is based on the Unreal Engine, so it is suitably shiny in all the right places and the environments are lush and immersive. And the various races all have a distinct visual flavor that makes them feel quite unique as well.

Overall though, I'm having a ball with the game and have levelled a Priest to 30 and an Archer to 20-something, and I think I'm ready to go ahead and pony up for the subscription. :)

reviewText:
In my opinion, TERA seems like a pretty high-quality Massively Multiplayer Online game; from what I experienced in five hours, the story isn't half-bad, everything looks detailed (the scenery is occassionally rather pleasant), and jumping feels super satisfying.
I also found distaste within TERA during those five hours, and it predominates what I fancied, hence my negative review.
Combat felt dreadfully slow and boring in the beginning of the game, especially as a Support class, but I suppose fights become incredibly action-packed if TERA claims to have True Action Combat" with aiming and dodging and timing.
I suppose I just don't like intense and incredibly tactical fighting

reviewText:
Tera is a must try for MMO fans, or anyone familiar with the action/rpg genre willing to experiment with the Massively Multiplayer Online format. Look to Tera for fast action, engaging player progression, and stunning visuals. Not quite what you were looking for? Feel free to check out any of my other reviews and see if you find something that suites you better! Now, on to the review.

Still here? Fantastic. The rest of this review will be dedicated to a breakdown of Tera's positive and negative elements. I'll end with a few words on what makes this game worthy of your time, as well as a number score to refer to. Let's Jump right in with:

Why Tera stands appart from the competition:

-The Combat. This is the point you'll hear brought up the most often, and it is a significant one. Instead of the point-and-click adventure style gameplay of most MMORPG's, Tera prefers a more third person action perspective. Basically, your character movements feel responsive and quick, most monster and players have abilities that can be dodged by moving, and your own skills are manually aimed. This adds a deep skill element to the combat, and it feels great to know that combat isn't simply a matter of who has the higher ability or gear scores.

-The Character Design. This category is a bit of a double-edged sword, as Tera's anime-esq graphical and character design may be a turn off to some players. I had some reservations over this design choice going in, but was immediatly blown away by just how beautifully stylized everything looked. I feel that recently, MMORPG's have opted towards a sort of muddy" or gritty look with their character design. I found Tera's bright
recommended:
and addmittedly a bit sexed up player models to be nothing but refreshing and enjoyable.

-The Environments. Every area and dungeon in this game felt destinctive and thriving with life. Some of the more tropical areas in the game are truly a joy to explore.

-The RPG Elements. Each character automatically learns all their abilities as they level up
hoursPlayed: negating that feeling of horrible indecision about which skill to take when all

votesHelpful: every skill learned felt like it fit just right into the character's build

As a player that has achieved Exarch status in two of the three alliances, led PvP raids and Alliance Conflicts, and ground out mind numbing numbers of membranes for Nightforge PvP gear, I can tell you this game is a trap.

The first, and most blatant problem in the game is the community at large. As a F2P player base, the community is toxic to no end. You MAy get lucky and find adecent group worth latching on to for static runs, but by and large people are at their worst in this game, especially in PvP.
